derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin libatio(n-), from libare 'pour as an offering'

entry.tran: （古希腊和罗马供奉神的）鬯酒，祭酒，奠酒
entry.def: In ancient Greece and Rome, a libation was an alcoholic drink that was offered to the gods.

example.ex: At the shrine of the god there were offerings, libations and incense.
example.tran: 神殿里供奉着牺牲、鬯酒和贡香。

means.word_mean: 1. (facetious) a serving of an alcoholic beverage
2. a serving (of wine) poured out in honor of a deity
3. the act of pouring a liquid offering (especially wine) as a religious ceremony
奠酒;祭奠用的酒;饮酒, 酒
